result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same conditions as probation, if revoked

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% prison funds, balance to be paid during term of ES; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Pay all supervision fees.

- Obtain/maintain employment and or school.
- Obtain Diploma, GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.

- Cooperate with Agent.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA HEARING commencing MARCH 23, 2016 received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY TERESE DICK   826 N. 6TH STREET 9TH FLOOR,  MILWAUKEE, WI 53203
Transcript commencing 04-21-2016 Sentencing  received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 15cf5487 (31 Pages).

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Edward Lee in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS. INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 8 days time served if revoked. Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION AND PROBATION:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment and or school
-Obtain Diploma, GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Random urine screens 
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Pretrial Credit Sheet

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Edward Lee in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court will used an uncharged burglary at 3200 N. 36th Street, Milwaukee, WI on September 9, 2015.Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Edward Lee in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not contest the findings of Dr. Rawski.  Court sets bail in the amount of $2,500.00 cash.  Matter calendared for a "soft" plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton in court via telephone, defendant Edward Lee not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctor's report. Defense counsel is ill and cannot attend today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Edward Lee in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by Dr. Pankiewicz from the Forensic Unit.  Court suspends proceedings.  Order for Examination, signe, filed and forwarded to the Forensic Unit.  Matter scheduled for Doctor's Report Return.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Telephone call received from Attorney Danielle Shelton requesting a date in which she can raise competency on behalf of  her client.  ADA Anderson contacted regarding date and confirmed it accomodicates his calendar.  Matter calendared. Attorney Shelton indicated that her client does not have to be produced for this date.
Court sets no bail conditions

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Edward Lee not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch  Plea hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Lee not in court. Defendant is in the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff.    Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 19.  Return on warrant scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($600 = $100 +$500) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 600.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Defendant missed office visit.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 06/23/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

05-21-15
Court orders $600 cash bail ($100 previously posted, $500 remains due), all other conditions of bail previously ordered remain.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Patrick J Anderson and Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail hearing due to Justice Point violation.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
Defendant appeared for court and Bench Warrant was withdrawn.  Court admonishes the defendant and raises cash bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for plea and sentencing on 05/28/2015 at 8:30am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  Positive drug test.
Parties instructed to report to Branch 22 today at 1:15pm for bail review.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with LA MOROVENA, 1408 W WINDLAKE AVE., MILWAUKEE.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for calendar call, stayed bench warrant is withdrawn.  Justice Point Supervision is re-ordered.    Court orders defendant referred to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.     No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for plea and sentencing on 05/28/2015 at 8:30am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Calendar call scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case calendared for bail review in Branch 22 on 05/06/2015 at 8:30am to address Justice Point violation, parties notified.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith via telephone.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail IN THIS CASE.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for scheduling on 04/07/2015 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick Michael Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Edward Lee in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Edward Lee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
